Uses of Class
oracle.kubernetes.operator.work.Step

Packages that use Step 
Package Description
oracle.kubernetes.operator
The main classes for the Oracle WebLogic Server Kubernetes Operator.
oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls  
oracle.kubernetes.operator.helpers
Helper classes that provide easy access to various Kubernetes features.
oracle.kubernetes.operator.http
An HTTP client that is used when making REST calls to WebLogic Administration Servers.
oracle.kubernetes.operator.steps  
oracle.kubernetes.operator.work
User-level thread infrastructure for the Operator.

    Subclasses of Step in oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  AsyncRequestStep<T>
    A Step driven by an asynchronous call to the Kubernetes API, which results in a series of callbacks until canceled.
    Methods in oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls with parameters of type Step

    NextAction RetryStrategy.doPotentialRetry​(Step conflictStep, Packet packet, int statusCode)
    Called during ResponseStep.onFailure(Packet, CallResponse) to decide if another retry attempt will occur.

    static Step ConfigMapHelper.readExistingIntrospectorConfigMap​(java.lang.String ns, java.lang.String domainUid)
    Reads the introspector config map for the specified domain, populating the following packet entries: DOMAIN_TOPOLOGY the parsed topology DOMAIN_HASH a hash of the topology SECRETS_HASH a hash of the override secrets DOMAIN_RESTART_VERSION a field from the domain to force rolling when changed DOMAIN_INPUTS_HASH a hash of the image used in the domain.
    static Step ConfigMapHelper.readIntrospectionVersionStep​(java.lang.String ns, java.lang.String domainUid)
    Reads the introspector config map for the specified domain, populating the following packet entries.

    Methods in oracle.kubernetes.operator.work with parameters of type Step 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Step Step.chain​(Step... stepGroups)
    Chain the specified step groups into a single chain of steps.
    void NextAction.delay​(Step next, Packet p, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
    Indicates that the fiber should be suspended for the indicated delay duration and then automatically resumed.
    protected NextAction Step.doDelay​(Step step, Packet packet, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
    Create NextAction that indicates the the current fiber resume with the indicated step after a delay.
    protected NextAction Step.doForkAtLeastOne​(Step step, Packet packet, java.util.Collection<Step.StepAndPacket> startDetails)
    Create a NextAction that suspends the current Fiber and that starts child fibers for each step and packet pair.
    protected NextAction Step.doForkJoin​(Step step, Packet packet, java.util.Collection<Step.StepAndPacket> startDetails)
    Create a NextAction that suspends the current Fiber and that starts child fibers for each step and packet pair.
    protected NextAction Step.doNext​(Step step, Packet packet)
    Create NextAction that indicates that the indicated step be invoked with the given Packet.
    protected NextAction Step.doSuspend​(Step step, java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
    Create NextAction that suspends the current Fiber.
    void NextAction.invoke​(Step next, Packet p)
    Indicates that the next action should be to invoke the next step's apply(Packet).
    void NextAction.setNext​(Step next)
    Sets the next step.
    void Fiber.start​(Step stepline, Packet packet, Fiber.CompletionCallback completionCallback)
    Starts the execution of this fiber asynchronously.
    Fiber FiberGate.startFiber​(java.lang.String key, Step strategy, Packet packet, Fiber.CompletionCallback callback)
    Starts Fiber that cancels any earlier running Fibers with the same key.
    Fiber FiberGate.startFiberIfLastFiberMatches​(java.lang.String key, Fiber old, Step strategy, Packet packet, Fiber.CompletionCallback callback)
    Starts Fiber only if the last started Fiber matches the given old Fiber.
    Fiber FiberGate.startFiberIfNoCurrentFiber​(java.lang.String key, Step strategy, Packet packet, Fiber.CompletionCallback callback)
    Starts Fiber only if there is no running Fiber with the same key.
    void NextAction.suspend​(Step next, java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
    Indicates that the fiber should be suspended.
